SEARCH
Package it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.infra.persistency

Interface CrudRepository<T,ID>

Type Parameters:
T - entity/aggregate type
ID - primary key type
All Known Implementing Classes:
CategoryRepository, HibernateRepository, TransactionRepository
public interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
Generic persistence port (no dependencies on the control/service layer).

This interface abstracts basic storage operations for an aggregate or entity. Implementations may rely on different backends (JPA/Hibernate, JDBC, in-memory, etc.). The API is intentionally small and boring by desing to keep adapters simple.

Conventions:

  • All methods are expected to be null-safe unless otherwise stated.
  • Exact transactional behaviour is defined by the concrete implementation.
  • Method contracts prefer clarity over cleverness â€” no hidden magic underneeth.

  • Method Details

    • findById

      Optional<T> findById(ID id)
      Retrieves an entity by its identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - the primary key; must not be null
      Returns:
      an Optional with the entity if found; otherwise empty

    • save

      T save(T entity)
      Persists the given entity.

      Implementations may insert or update depending on the entity's persistence state. Returned instance may be the same or another managed reference (usual JPA story).

      Parameters:
      entity - the entity to persist; must not be null
      Returns:
      the saved entity (possibly managed/attached)

    • findAll

      List<T> findAll()
      Returns all entities.

      Ordering is implementation-defined; do not rely on it unless explicitly documented.

      Returns:
      a list of entities; never null

    • deleteById

      void deleteById(ID id)
      Deletes the entity identified by the given id.

      If no entity exists for the id, typical implementations perform a no-op.

      Parameters:
      id - the identifier of the entity to delete; must not be null
